subject: RE: [junit] junit.runner?
msgSnippet: Ajit, junit.runner is in JUnit3.5.  Make sure you have JUnit3.5 and look in the junit.jar file.  Do you have junit.jar in your classpath? -- Erik Meade
messageBody:
Ajit,

junit.runner is in JUnit3.5. Make sure you have JUnit3.5
and look in the junit.jar file. Do you have junit.jar in
your classpath?

--
Erik Meade emeade@...
Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ajit Bhat [mailto:avbhat@...]
> Sent: Monday, February 26, 2001 4:41 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] junit.runner?
>
>
> Hi,
> I'm new to Junit. I'm tryiing to write testcases using JUnit. In
> sample code
> that come with JUnitEE there's one import line :
> import junit.runner.*;
>
> and the test class extends BaseTestRunner...
>
> Where is this framework? it's not in JUnit 3.5 ??
>
> Thanks in advance...
> Ajit.
>
